name: Outro
_source: speak;Duessel;Prince Ephraim...|You've grown to be quite the impressive commander.|I remember what a stubborn young lad you were when I taught you.
speak;Ephraim;Any skill I have, I owe to you, Duessel.|I'm curious, why are you being pursued by your own troops?
speak;Ephraim;Speak to me, Duessel.|I want to put an end to this war.|I'm sure you feel the same way.
speak;Duessel;...As you know, the emperor was once a man of compassion.|He loathed war, and he worked to build peace across all nations.|Then...one day that all changed.
speak;Ephraim;But why?|Why did he change?|What happened?

speak;Duessel;I wish I knew.|But if you're looking for a likely cause, I have one.|This all seems to have begun when Prince Lyon and the mages created a strange gemstone they referred to as the Dark Stone.

speak;Duessel;That's what the clerics and the prince called it, at any rate.|Now, I'm just a soldier.|I don't know anything about these magic things.|But they said the Dark Stone is more powerful even than the Sacred Stones.
speak;Ephraim;And the Sacred Stones had the power to defeat the Demon King.|If the Dark Stone is stronger than they are...
speak;Myrrh;The wave of evil I felt surging from the capital...|It hungers...|It consumes. It envelops and transforms.|This power can tarnish the purest of souls with its corruption.
speak;Ephraim;Are you saying this Dark Stone is responsible for the change in Vigarde?|The timing fits, doesn't it?|The stone is created, and then-|Duessel, where is the Dark Stone now?
speak;Duessel;It's in the capital, with Prince Lyon.|He's been carrying it with him ever since the day it was created.
speak;Ephraim;Understood.|Duessel, I'm going to the capital.|I must talk to Lyon.|Maybe we can restore the emperor together.
speak;Ephraim;But we'll be fighting Grado's army-your own men.

speak;Duessel;I appreciate your concern, but I've already been branded a traitor.|Prince Ephraim, if you mean to save my lord the emperor...|If you hope to restore him to his former self...|then I will pledge my loyalty to you until your cause is won.
speak;Duessel;Men, I owe each of you an apology.|You've served me well, and I have betrayed you.
speak;SoldierGreen;You speak nonsense, General!|We are your men, no matter what happens!|If you must leave Grado to fight with Frelia's men, then our place is at your side.|Your road is our road!
speak;Duessel;My brave men...|Sniff... Bah, I'm getting old.|I'm a sentimental old fool.

speak;SoldierGreen;We ask to be allowed to join the Frelian army.|Prince Ephraim has many soldiers.|He doesn't need us with him.|Please, send us older soldiers off to fight with Frelia.|And may the gods of war smile upon you, General Duessel.
speak;Seth;Prince Ephraim, we must now take to the seas.|The Frelian army is readying a ship for us now.|We have some time to rest until it's ready to set sail.
speak;Ephraim;Right.|We'll take a break, then.|Tell the men.|The road ahead is bound or be a rough one.
speak;Larachel;Well, hello there!|Tell me, are you all waiting to board a ship?
speak;Larachel;I recommend that you abandon your plans, my friends.|The locals are too frightened to set sail upon these seas.
speak;Ephraim;Is there a storm coming in?
speak;Larachel;No, no storm-demons.|Some sort of phantom ship commands these seas now.
speak;Larachel;Yes.|But you needn't worry for long, my friends.|I plan on purging the seas of that pesky ghost ship.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Well said, Princess L'Arachel!
speak;Larachel;I, L'Arachel, am destined to become the protector of the seas!|Fare thee well, strangers.|Come, Dozla, we must find a ship.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Sounds fun!|Come on, Rennac!
speak;Rennac;Honestly, L'Arachel, do you even think before you set these plans?|Oh, please...|Someone end my misery!
speak;Seth;Prince Ephraim, our ship has arrived.|Let us prepare to board.|...Something troubling you?
